Projects.title: Project 001 : Audit
desc: Learning the auditing process a cybersecurity professional is usually tasked with was a very interesting experience. I actually started this project in 2024 independently and didn’t really have any direction. It was one of those cases where I did the assignment and just moved on. I decided to enhance my studies and revisit the project to understand the process better.

I wanted to create an audit that reflected current security standards and my professional brand as well. Using Affinity, I created an audit template with a structured design in mind. Separating each step in addressing the company’s audit categories, I was able to display a clear process of my observations.

I experienced an improvement in how I represent other people through my words. Throughout the entire project, I kept in mind, “How can I make this easier to understand for someone who isn’t knowledgeable on this topic? How did I learn this process?”. I understood that multiple people would read this type of document, and everyone would have to identify the same exact problems and solutions.

Projects.title: Project 002 : Incident Reports
desc: I knew that incident reporting was a crucial task in multiple tech-based roles and was excited to get some hands-on experience! For each fictional scenario, I was tasked with addressing the incident, providing evidence, and suggesting future improvements on how to reduce the risk factors within the concentrated areas.

reports.title: 01 Access Error
desc: I wanted to get more experience reading strings in real-time and understanding what happens in the backend when someone accesses a web service client. This was my first time setting up Linux on a virtual machine and I learned so much! I utilized ChatGPT to help me learn how to simulate this exact scenario and refuse my connection to the specified domain.
